title: "August 24-December 16" serif face
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121224851im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/august_6610.jpg)

Thanks in advance.  
It reminds me a little bit of ITC Clearface but it’s not that one.

 [‹ (x) Wieselburger Bier logo - similar to Herold {Mike Y}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121224851/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40527 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Exhibit font in National Geographic Museum, Explorers Hall, DC - Kleptocracy {Florian} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121224851/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40486 "Go to next forum topic")
author: 1UP

comments.content:
Hi Joakim,  
it has a lot in common with [PTL Skopex Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121224851/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/primetype/ptl_skopex_serif_regular_ot/?sample_text=August%2024%20December%2016&sample_size=36&acs_ss=-1&acs_p=1&acs_pt=24&acs=1), though that’s not it.  
F

Thanks Florian,  
That’s a very good alternative for sure!
In fact I think It might be it!

The numerals are different, but the letters seem to match.

- Mike Yanega

<cite>the letters seem to match</cite>

No, the ‘s’ and the ‘b’ are clearly different. More subtle: the right part of the ‘e’ bowl, the ear of the ‘r’, … hard to tell.  
Could it be a customised version?
